title: Long-Term Memory: Unlimited but Unreliable
description: A short lesson to help you apply Long-Term Memory: Unlimited but Unreliable.

hook.text: Your long-term memory has no known storage limit. But it rewrites itself every time you remember.

buildup.text: Unlike a hard drive, memory doesn't store files‚Äîit reconstructs them from scattered traces.

discovery.text: Each retrieval slightly modifies the memory, blending it with current feelings and context.

twist.text: Your most vivid memories are often the most distorted‚Äîemotion amplifies confidence, not accuracy.

climax.text: Eyewitness testimony, once considered gold-standard evidence, is now known to be deeply flawed.

punchline.text: Memory is not a recording. It's a story you tell yourself.

quiz.question: Why is long-term memory described as 'unreliable'?
